title: [bug] Unable to run sidecar example due to regex version conflict

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

I'm new to tauri and was following the instructions here: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/tree/dev/examples/sidecar

When trying to run the app I encounter an error:

```console
/tmp/tauri/examples/sidecar$ npx yarn tauri dev
yarn run v1.22.19
warning package.json: No license field
$ node ../../tooling/cli/node/tauri.js dev
     Running BeforeDevCommand (`yarn package`)
        Info Watching /tmp/tauri/examples/sidecar/src-tauri for changes...
warning package.json: No license field
$ pkg package.json --output src-tauri/binaries/app && node scripts/move-binary.js
> pkg@5.2.1
> Targets not specified. Assuming:
  node14-linux-x64
    Updating crates.io index
error: failed to select a version for `regex`.
    ... required by package `tauri-codegen v1.0.3 (/tmp/tauri/core/tauri-codegen)`
    ... which satisfies path dependency `tauri-codegen` of package `tauri-build v1.0.3 (/tmp/tauri/core/tauri-build)`
    ... which satisfies path dependency `tauri-build` of package `sidecar v0.1.0 (/tmp/tauri/examples/sidecar/src-tauri)`
versions that meet the requirements `^1.6.0` are: 1.6.0

all possible versions conflict with previously selected packages.

  previously selected package `regex v1.5.6`
    ... which satisfies dependency `regex = "^1.1.5"` (locked to 1.5.6) of package `globset v0.4.9`
    ... which satisfies dependency `globset = "^0.4.7"` (locked to 0.4.9) of package `ignore v0.4.18`
    ... which satisfies dependency `ignore = "^0.4"` (locked to 0.4.18) of package `tauri v1.0.3 (/tmp/tauri/core/tauri)`
    ... which satisfies path dependency `tauri` of package `sidecar v0.1.0 (/tmp/tauri/examples/sidecar/src-tauri)`

failed to select a version for `regex` which could resolve this conflict
error Command failed with exit code 101.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

If I downgrade the `regex` dependency in `tauri/core/tauri-codegen/Cargo.toml` to 1.5.6 (i.e. how it was before https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/pull/4600) everything works fine. 

### Reproduction

_No response_

### Expected behavior

The demo app runs.

### Platform and versions

```shell
> sidecar@1.0.0 tauri /tmp/tauri/examples/sidecar
> node ../../tooling/cli/node/tauri.js "info"


Environment
  › OS: Ubuntu 20.04 X64
  › Node.js: 14.19.3
  › npm: 6.14.17
  › pnpm: Not installed!
  › yarn: Not installed!
  › rustup: 1.24.3
  › rustc: 1.62.0
  › cargo: 1.62.0
  › Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu 

Packages
  › @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.0.3
  › @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: Not installed!
  › tauri [RUST]: 1.0.3,
  › tauri-build [RUST]: 1.0.3,
  › tao [RUST]: 0.12.0,
  › wry [RUST]: 0.19.0,

App
  › build-type: bundle
  › CSP: default-src 'self'
  › distDir: ["../index.html"]
  › devPath: ["../index.html"]

App directory structure
  ├─ node_modules
  ├─ scripts
  ├─ src
  └─ src-tauri
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
